org.nodex.java.core.Handler

    • Uses of Handler in org.nodex.java.core

      Subinterfaces of Handler in org.nodex.java.core 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  CompletionHandler<T>
      A handler that will be called when a Future completes or fails.
      Classes in org.nodex.java.core that implement Handler 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  SimpleHandler
      This class can be used for simple handlers which don't receive any value.
      Methods in org.nodex.java.core with parameters of type Handler 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ConnectionPool.getConnection(Handler<T> handler, long contextID)
      Get a connection from the pool.
      void Nodex.nextTick(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
      Call the specified event handler asynchronously on the next "tick" of the event loop.
      <T> long Nodex.registerHandler(Handler<T> handler)
      Register a global handler with the system.
      long Nodex.setPeriodic(long delay, Handler<java.lang.Long> handler)
      Set a periodic timer to fire every delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.
      long Nodex.setTimer(long delay, Handler<java.lang.Long> handler)
      Set a one-shot timer to fire after delay milliseconds, at which point handler will be called with the id of the timer.

    • Uses of Handler in org.nodex.java.core.http

      Methods in org.nodex.java.core.http with parameters of type Handler 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void HttpServer.close(Handler<java.lang.Void> doneHandler)
      Close the server.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClient.connect(java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method returns an HttpClientRequest instance which represents an HTTP CONNECT request with the specified uri.
      void HttpClient.connectWebsocket(java.lang.String uri, Handler<Websocket> wsConnect)
      Attempt to connect an HTML5 websocket to the specified URI
      void HttpClientRequest.continueHandler(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
      If you send an HTTP request with the header Expect set to the value 100-continue and the server responds with an interim HTTP response with a status code of 100 and a continue handler has been set using this method, then the handler will be called.
      void HttpServerRequest.dataHandler(Handler<Buffer> dataHandler)
      Specify a data handler for the request.
      void Websocket.dataHandler(Handler<Buffer> handler)
      Specify a data handler for the websocket.
      void HttpClientResponse.dataHandler(Handler<Buffer> dataHandler)
      Specify a data handler for the response.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClient.delete(java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method returns an HttpClientRequest instance which represents an HTTP DELETE request with the specified uri.
      void HttpClientRequest.drainHandler(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
      This method sets a drain handler handler on the request.
      void HttpServerResponse.drainHandler(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
      This method sets a drain handler handler on the response.
      void Websocket.drainHandler(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
      This method sets a drain handler handler on the websocket.
      void HttpServerRequest.endHandler(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
      Specify an end handler for the request.
      void Websocket.endHandler(Handler<java.lang.Void> handler)
      Specify an end handler for the websocket.
      void HttpClientResponse.endHandler(Handler<java.lang.Void> endHandler)
      Specify an end handler for the response.
      void HttpClientRequest.exceptionHandler(Handler<java.lang.Exception> handler)
      Set handler as an exception handler on the request.
      void HttpServerResponse.exceptionHandler(Handler<java.lang.Exception> handler)
      Set handler as an exception handler on the response.
      void HttpServerRequest.exceptionHandler(Handler<java.lang.Exception> handler)
      Specify an exception handler for the request.

      Specify an exception handler for the websocket.
      void HttpClient.exceptionHandler(Handler<java.lang.Exception> handler)
      Set the exception handler for the HttpClient
      void HttpClientResponse.exceptionHandler(Handler<java.lang.Exception> exceptionHandler)
      Specify an exception handler for the response.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClient.get(java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method returns an HttpClientRequest instance which represents an HTTP GET request with the specified uri.
      void HttpClient.getNow(java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This is a quick version of the get() method where you do not want to do anything with the request before sending.
      void HttpClient.getNow(java.lang.String uri, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends java.lang.Object> headers, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method works in the same manner as HttpClient.getNow(String, org.nodex.java.core.Handler), except that it allows you specify a set of headers that will be sent with the request.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClient.head(java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method returns an HttpClientRequest instance which represents an HTTP HEAD request with the specified uri.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClient.options(java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method returns an HttpClientRequest instance which represents an HTTP OPTIONS request with the specified uri.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClient.post(java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method returns an HttpClientRequest instance which represents an HTTP POST request with the specified uri.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClient.put(java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method returns an HttpClientRequest instance which represents an HTTP PUT request with the specified uri.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClient.request(java.lang.String method, java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method returns an HttpClientRequest instance which represents an HTTP request with the specified uri.
      HttpServer HttpServer.requestHandler(Handler<HttpServerRequest> requestHandler)
      Set the request handler for the server to requestHandler.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClient.trace(java.lang.String uri, Handler<HttpClientResponse> responseHandler)
      This method returns an HttpClientRequest instance which represents an HTTP TRACE request with the specified uri.
      HttpServer HttpServer.websocketHandler(Handler<Websocket> wsHandler)
      Set the websocket handler for the server to wsHandler.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClientRequest.write(Buffer chunk, Handler<java.lang.Void> doneHandler)
      Write a Buffer to the request body.
      HttpServerResponse HttpServerResponse.write(Buffer chunk, Handler<java.lang.Void> doneHandler)
      Write a Buffer to the response body.
      HttpClientRequest HttpClientRequest.write(java.lang.String chunk, Handler<java.lang.Void> doneHandler)
      Write a String to the request body, encoded in UTF-8.
      HttpServerResponse HttpServerResponse.write(java.lang.String chunk, Handler<java.lang.Void> doneHandler)
      Write a String to the response body, encoded in UTF-8.

      Write a String to the request body, encoded with encoding enc.

      NetClient NetClient.connect(int port, Handler<NetSocket> connectCallback)
      Attempt to open a connection to a server at the specific port and host localhost The connect is done asynchronously and on success, a NetSocket instance is supplied via the connectHandler instance

    • Uses of Handler in org.nodex.java.core.parsetools

      Classes in org.nodex.java.core.parsetools that implement Handler 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  RecordParser
      A helper class which allows you to easily parse protocols which are delimited by a sequence of bytes, or fixed size records.
      Methods in org.nodex.java.core.parsetools with parameters of type Handler 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static RecordParser RecordParser.newDelimited(byte[] delim, Handler<Buffer> output)
      Create a new RecordParser instance, initially in delimited mode, and where the delimiter can be represented by the byte[] delim.
      static RecordParser RecordParser.newDelimited(java.lang.String delim, Handler<Buffer> output)
      Create a new RecordParser instance, initially in delimited mode, and where the delimiter can be represented by the String delim endcoded in latin-1 .
      static RecordParser RecordParser.newFixed(int size, Handler<Buffer> output)
      Create a new RecordParser instance, initially in fixed size mode, and where the record size is specified by the size parameter.
